alert.note: Alert for Brown; Jackson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 15 at 4:28PM CST until December 15 at 4:45PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CST FOR NORTHWESTERN SHAWNEE...NORTHEASTERN WABAUNSEE...EASTERN POTTAWATOMIE...JACKSON...EASTERN NEMAHA AND WESTERN BROWN COUNTIES... At 427 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles south of Verdon to 4 miles northwest of Keene, moving east at 65 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS FOR the warned area. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Holton, Sabetha, Rossville, St. Marys, Silver Lake, Maple Hill, Wetmore, Fairview, McFarland, Morrill, Paxico, Belvue, Emmett, Circleville, Delia, Bern, Corning, Netawaka, Soldier and Havensville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 326 and 354. At 4:20 PM, a storm spotter reported 70 MPH wind gusts. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for northeastern Kansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Brown; Jackson; Nemaha; Pottawatomie; Shawnee; Wabaunsee
